intro: Silene holopetala var. gavrilovii, commonly known as the Gavrilovii campion, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or white, with five petals that are fused at the base. The plant grows in rocky or alpine habitats, often in areas with limited soil and extreme climatic conditions. Its leaves are usually basal, forming a rosette, and the stems are upright with few branches. This variety is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
